description: X-files-on-the-frontier expansion: mythic anomalies, abductions, infections, conspiracies, and emergent story arcs for Old Trail's event director & encounter system.

caseFiles.title: Case File: The Gray Trail
caseFiles.synopsis: Lights that don't burn, footsteps that leave no prints, and 'surveyors' who ask about your dreams. The trail feels watched.
caseFiles.starterRumor: Someone swears a star fell behind the bluffs, and the next morning their oxen wouldn't look west.

caseFiles.title: Case File: The Open Eye Covenant
caseFiles.synopsis: A quiet cult travels faster than wagons: inked eyes on paper, charms at throats, whispered 'blessings' traded for flour.
caseFiles.starterRumor: They say if you burn the leaflet, smoke curls into an eye and follows your wagon for three nights.

caseFiles.title: Case File: The Black Oil
caseFiles.synopsis: Tar that moves like it listens. A sheen in the creek. Something in the blood that wants the fire put out.
caseFiles.starterRumor: A man at the last fort warned: 'If you see the oil shine, don't let it see you back.'

caseFiles.title: Case File: The Mirror Road
caseFiles.synopsis: Same hill twice. The sun wrong. A wagon that reflects futures you didn't earn. Time creaks like wood.
caseFiles.starterRumor: A journal page repeats itself, word for word, but the ink is fresher each time.

caseFiles.title: Case File: Bone Valley
caseFiles.synopsis: A valley where the ground is white with old bones. Wind whistles like a flute through ribs the size of barrels.
caseFiles.starterRumor: They say if you pocket a tooth from that valley, your dreams will chew on you.

caseFiles.title: Case File: The Fungal Bloom
caseFiles.synopsis: Glowing caps under fallen logs. Spore clouds like faint lantern smoke. Memories that rot and regrow.
caseFiles.starterRumor: An old hunter swore the mushrooms were 'listening' when the campfire told stories.

caseFiles.title: Case File: The Hollow Herd
caseFiles.synopsis: Oxen found standing, eyes blank. Tracks that turn into bare feet. A howl that sounds almost like a name.
caseFiles.starterRumor: Someone carved a warning at Register Rock: 'DON'T FOLLOW THE TRACKS BACKWARD.'

caseFiles.title: Case File: The Lost Regiment
caseFiles.synopsis: Bootsteps at dawn with no men to wear them. Drumbeats over empty prairie. Dispatches signed by names that never lived here.
caseFiles.starterRumor: A child said a blue-coated man saluted the wagon and asked what year it was.

traits.label: Abductee
traits.summary: Lost time; gained scars. Notices patterns in the dark.

traits.label: Implanted
traits.summary: Carries something under the skin that sometimes hums.

traits.label: Latent Psychic
traits.summary: Dreams arrive before events. Hears trouble in quiet weather.

traits.label: Hybrid Blood
traits.summary: Not entirely human—or not entirely ordinary.

traits.label: Conspiracy Mind
traits.summary: Sees motives behind coincidences; spreads paranoia or preparation.

traits.label: Star Mapper
traits.summary: Reads the sky like a ledger; rarely gets truly lost.

traits.label: Ink-Touched
traits.summary: Calmer around charms and scribbles; unsettled by clean paper.

traits.label: Oathbound
traits.summary: Swore a quiet vow to the Open Eye. Keeps watch without being asked.

traits.label: Oil Carrier
traits.summary: Seems healthier than they should—until the fire goes out.

traits.label: Mirrorstruck
traits.summary: Sometimes speaks in two tenses. Hates still water.

traits.label: Time-Sense
traits.summary: Knows when hours are being stolen; wakes before loops.

traits.label: Bone Listener
traits.summary: Hears wind in old ribs; can spot fossils and fractures.

traits.label: Cryptid Hunter
traits.summary: Believes every tale has tracks. Good shot, bad bedtime stories.

traits.label: Mycelial Symbiote
traits.summary: Recovered from spores—different. Learns plants quickly.

traits.label: Bluecoat Echo
traits.summary: Hears marching that others don't. Stands straighter at dawn.

traits.label: Telegraph Tinker
traits.summary: Knows wire, batteries, and secret codes. Improvises repairs.

traits.label: Gentle Medium
traits.summary: Comforts the shaken; claims to hear the dead without fear.

traits.label: Hard Case
traits.summary: Has seen too much to panic easily. Others borrow their calm.

afflictions.label: Gray Fever
afflictions.cause: Exposure to radiant debris or 'light' that left no burn.

afflictions.label: Implant Stitches
afflictions.cause: Fresh cuts from a procedure nobody admits to.
afflictions.cureHint: Keep clean; doctoring reduces infection chance.

afflictions.label: Black Oil Infection
afflictions.cause: Contact with moving tar, tainted water, or contaminated food.
afflictions.cureHint: Ash salve + doctoring. Avoid sharing water skins.

afflictions.label: Ink Sickness
afflictions.cause: Fever after handling wet, strange ink.

afflictions.label: Time Sickness
afflictions.cause: Too many repeated hours or wrong reflections.

afflictions.label: Mirror Split
afflictions.cause: Derealization after seeing oneself where one shouldn't be.

afflictions.label: Bone Dust Cough
afflictions.cause: Breathing chalky dust in dry valleys.

afflictions.label: Cryptid Bite
afflictions.cause: Bite from something that didn't match any tracks.

afflictions.label: Radiant Burn
afflictions.cause: Sunburn-like injury from a crash site's glow.

afflictions.label: Battle Fugue
afflictions.cause: Panic after hearing unseen drums or marching.

curios.name: Star Map Scrap
curios.shortDesc: Oilcloth charted with constellations that don't match any book you own.

curios.name: Inked Eye Charm
curios.shortDesc: A small charm painted with an open eye. It feels heavier when lies are told nearby.

curios.name: Blessing Bundle
curios.shortDesc: Herbs and cord tied in a careful knot. Smells like safety and smoke.

curios.name: Sealed Oil Vial
curios.shortDesc: A sealed vial of black oil. It never freezes, no matter the pass.

curios.name: Mirror Shard
curios.shortDesc: A fragment that reflects roads not taken. Looking too long makes hours slip.

curios.name: Bone Whistle
curios.shortDesc: A whistle carved from old bone. Sometimes it sounds without breath.

curios.name: Mycelium Charm
curios.shortDesc: Dried fungus braided into twine. It 'remembers' where food grows.

curios.name: Antler Talisman
curios.shortDesc: Carved antler notches—each one a warning. Oxen calm when it's near.

curios.name: Dull Medal
curios.shortDesc: Unmarked metal disc on frayed ribbon. Warm at dawn, cold at noon.

curios.name: Stamped Gray Token
curios.shortDesc: A coin with no mint. Symbols run the rim like stitches.

items.label: Alien Alloy Shard
items.notes: Lightweight metal; used in repairs or traded to 'surveyors'.

items.label: Etched Disc
items.notes: Thin disc with concentric scratches; sometimes warms in a pocket.

items.label: Cinder Glass
items.notes: Green-black glass from a melt scar; can be knapped into a blade.

items.label: Star Map Scrap
items.notes: Oilcloth with unfamiliar constellations; improves navigation when studied.

items.label: Agency Token
items.notes: Stamped brass token that opens doors (or closes mouths).

items.label: Inked Leaflet
items.notes: Paper marked with an open eye.

items.label: Eye Charm
items.notes: Bone or clay charm painted with an eye.

items.label: Salt-Cord Bundle
items.notes: Twine stiff with salt and herbs; hung on wagon tongues.

items.label: Blessed Herbs
items.notes: Smells like sage and pennyroyal; calms morale swings.

items.label: Black Oil Vial
items.notes: Sealed in glass. Valuable and dangerous.

items.label: Tar Grease
items.notes: Useful for wagon axles; risky if mishandled.

items.label: Ash Salve
items.notes: Charcoal and fat; rumored to 'draw out' the oil.

items.label: Mirror Shard
items.notes: Polished fragment that shows faint images of other roads.

items.label: Time Chalk
items.notes: Marks that don't wash away—unless the day repeats.

items.label: Brass Gear
items.notes: Oddly precise teeth; fits nothing you own until it suddenly does.

items.label: Fossil Tooth
items.notes: Too big for a man; collectors pay well.

items.label: Bone Whistle
items.notes: Whistles without breath on cold nights.

items.label: White Bone Dust
items.notes: Irritates lungs.

items.label: Glow-Cap Mushroom
items.notes: Edible? Sometimes. Bright enough to read by.

items.label: Spore Sample Jar
items.notes: Collectors want it. So do doctors who don't fear dreams.

items.label: Bitter Tea Bricks
items.notes: Staves off nausea; tastes like wet wood.

items.label: Antler Talisman
items.notes: Worn antler carved with notches.

items.label: Hollow Horn
items.notes: A horn that echoes wrong.

items.label: Sinew Thread
items.notes: Strong thread for repairs.

items.label: Dull Medal
items.notes: Unmarked medal that grows warm at dawn.

items.label: Powdered Ink Packet
items.notes: For copying dispatches; stains like bruises.

items.label: Dispatch Tape
items.notes: Waxed cloth strip with numbers; telegraph men crave it.

items.label: Register Rock Rubbing
items.notes: Charcoal rubbing of names; sometimes includes one that isn't yours yet.

items.label: Soda Springs Bottle
items.notes: Carbonated water in glass; boosts morale briefly.

items.label: Strange Battery
items.notes: Copper-zinc cell wired wrong; powers nothing you own—until it does.

factions.label: Star Watchers
factions.description: A loose network of surveyors and telegraph men who appear after 'falling stars'.
factions.notes: Optional; can be folded into men_in_gray.

factions.label: Bone Pickers
factions.description: Fossil hunters and grave-robbers posing as naturalists. They buy teeth and sell superstition.

factions.label: Timekeepers
factions.description: A rumor more than a group: people who leave chalk marks where days repeat.

factions.label: Mycelial Friends
factions.description: Foragers who swear the fungus is a medicine, not a curse. They trade spores and tea.

rumorLines: A telegraph man swore he heard code coming from the sky—three taps, then silence.
They say the Platte runs bad with sickness, but some nights the water runs with light.
A wagon passed yesterday with no tracks behind it. Folks blamed wind. No one laughed.
A preacher claims the Open Eye can 'see' through canvas and flesh alike.
Someone found a ring of burned grass with glass like green ice in the center.
In the high pass, a voice calls your name from under the snow. Don't answer it.
A man at a fort swore he met himself on the road. The other one was better fed.
They say you can buy safety with a stamped token, but the price is telling the truth.
If you see a clean mirror on the trail, turn it facedown. It steals hours.
The Bone Valley wind sounds like flute music, but no one carries a flute.
A peddler buys bone teeth and sells 'medicine' that tastes like chalk and fear.
A woman returned after a storm with stitches she couldn't explain and a calmer voice.
They say the men in gray won't hurt you if you never say what you saw aloud.
A set of tracks went backward for a mile, then turned into bare feet.
A fort clerk keeps a second ledger for trades that never happened. Or haven't yet.
A cracked bottle from Soda Springs kept fizzing for three days with no cork.
Some nights the stars are arranged wrong. Don't point it out. Just keep moving.
A black smear on a rock looked wet, but left no stain. It watched.
A bone whistle can keep wolves away—unless the wolves are listening for it.
A lantern that burns without fuel will guide you—until it guides something else to you.
At Soda Springs the bubbles spell letters—if you stare long enough to read them.
A small metal gear fits nothing you own until the day it saves your wagon.
A badge without a name can open a door and close a mouth. Choose one.
They say there are two Oregon Trails: the one you walk, and the one that walks you.
The trail takes what it wants, but sometimes it gives back the wrong thing.

effects.text: A new case file begins, whether you want it or not.

encounter.title: Case files in the dust
body: A page tears loose from a ledger you don't remember packing. It smells like ozone and campfire smoke.
In neat handwriting: CASE FILES — observations along the Oregon Trail. The first line is already filled in.

options.label: Read the case file
options.hint: Let the strange story take root.

effects.text: You leave with ink on your fingers and new worries.

encounter.title: Rumor board behind the stores
body: Behind the trading post, scraps of paper are pinned to a board: lost oxen, bounties, prayers, warnings.
One scrap is written in a sharper hand: IF YOU SAW THE LIGHT, DON'T SAY WHAT IT WAS.

options.label: Ignore it
options.hint: You're here to buy flour, not nightmares.

options.label: Ask the clerk about it
options.hint: The clerk's smile doesn't reach his eyes.

effects.text: The rock keeps its secrets; you carry only guesses.

encounter.title: Names on Register Rock
encounter.subtitle: Register Rock
body: Names and dates cover the stone—thousands of them, pressed into charcoal and pride.
You find one that matches your leader's name, but the date is next year.

options.label: Scratch your name beside it
options.hint: Make the future match the stone.

options.label: Leave it alone
options.hint: Don't touch the thing that knows you.

log.text: Along the riverbank, a faint shimmer dances on the water—like oil, like moonlight, like neither.

encounter.title: Soda Springs bubbles
encounter.subtitle: Soda Springs
body: The spring fizzes like it’s alive. The bubbles gather in lines that almost look like letters.
Someone jokes it's a message. No one laughs on the second line.

log.text: Rain falls with a sharp scent, like pennies and smoke. Droplets leave tiny dark specks on canvas.
Lightning forks behind the clouds, bright as noon—yet the thunder arrives as a whisper, hours late.
A pale light moves across the clouds in clean angles—too steady for a lantern, too low for a star.

encounter.title: The owl on the canvas
body: At dawn, an owl sits on the wagon canvas, staring as if it owns the inventory.
When you blink, you realize you can't remember the last few minutes.

options.label: Watch it quietly
options.hint: See if it leaves a sign.

log.text: A low hum rolls over the prairie like a distant wire vibrating. The fire burns lower than it should.

thought.label: Could not sleep for the hum

encounter.title: Surveyors on the road
body: Two riders in gray coats wave you down. Their saddlebags are too clean for the trail.
They ask, politely, whether you've seen a falling star—or heard anything 'unusual' at night.

encounter.title: A bedroll is empty
body: A shout cuts through the night. One bedroll is empty—still warm, as if the sleeper stood up mid-breath.
No tracks. No struggle. Just a faint smell of ozone.

options.label: Search with lanterns
options.hint: Risk the dark to find them.

options.label: Circle the wagons
options.hint: Protect the rest; wait for dawn.

encounter.title: Returned
body: They return at the edge of camp as if stepping out from behind a curtain.
Their clothes are damp with dew. Their eyes are tired. A bandage sits where no wound was yesterday.

options.label: Question them gently
options.hint: Try to learn without breaking them.

options.label: Accept it and move on
options.hint: On the trail, you take what you can get back.

encounter.title: Fireball beyond the ridge
body: A streak of fire tears the sky and vanishes behind a ridge. A second later: a soft boom, like faraway thunder.
The air smells briefly of hot stone and copper.

options.label: Mark the place and move on

encounter.title: A peddler with clean hands
body: A lone peddler approaches on a pale horse. His hands are clean. His eyes are tired.
He offers a stamped gray token. 'Keeps the watchers polite,' he says. 'Costs you something you can afford.'

options.label: Trade 1 treasure for the token
options.hint: A small price for a large promise.

log.text: Someone wakes with a sharp pain under the skin—then a brief, distant chorus like singing wire.
Tangled in sagebrush you find oilcloth covered in star marks that don't match the sky. It feels important anyway.
Leaflets tumble through camp like dry leaves. Each shows the same inked open eye, staring up at the sky.

encounter.title: Procession of the Open Eye
body: A line of travelers walks beside the trail, quiet as a funeral. Their necklaces are charms painted with eyes.
Their leader offers trade—then asks if you have 'seen the watchers in the clouds.'

options.label: Listen to their doctrine
options.hint: It might steady morale—or break it.

options.label: Accept a charm and walk a mile with them

encounter.title: A river blessing
body: A traveler offers to tie a salt cord to your wagon tongue and speak a blessing over the water skins.
They say the Open Eye hates thirst and loves witnesses.

options.label: Pay for extra cord and herbs
Burn the cord as a warning

log.text: Someone dreams of an eye drawn in smoke. They wake with their hand stained as if they’d been writing.

encounter.title: Salt circle
body: With no one posted on guard, someone suggests a salt circle around the wagons.
It feels foolish. It also feels… necessary.

options.label: Make the circle
options.hint: Use cord and salt to buy a night of sleep.

encounter.title: Charm seller
body: A peddler lays out eye charms and bundles of herbs on a blanket. 'Protection,' he says, 'priced for travelers.'
His shadow doesn't quite match his movements.

options.label: Buy a charm (1 treasure)
options.hint: A small wager against the unknown.

options.label: Barter with pelts (2 pelts)
options.hint: Trade proof of survival for promises.

encounter.title: The prophet by the fire
body: A stranger sits by your fire as if invited. He speaks in soft certainty about who will live and who will not.
He says the Open Eye showed him your wagon on the trail weeks ago.

options.label: Hear him out
options.hint: Knowledge, even false, can guide choices.

options.label: Offer food and ask for a blessing

log.text: Someone handled the leaflets for too long. Their fingers stain dark, and a low fever follows.
A thin black sheen drifts on the creek. It moves against the current like it's thinking.

encounter.title: Tar pit
body: You find a tar pit bubbling quietly. The smell is sharp and sweet, like burnt sugar.
A little grease could help the wagon axles. Or poison the whole trip.

encounter.title: Meat that shouldn't be here
body: Someone finds a bundle of fresh meat wrapped in cloth, left near camp as if a gift.
The fat gleams with a dark sheen in the firelight.

options.label: Cook it thoroughly
options.hint: Food is food when you're hungry.

options.label: Save it to trade
options.hint: Let someone else take the risk.

encounter.title: The fire goes out
body: The campfire gutters, then dies as if a hand pressed it down. No wind. No rain.
In the darkness, someone whispers: 'Don't light it.'

options.label: Wait in the dark
options.hint: Listen for what wants the fire dead.

encounter.title: A healer with soot on her hands
body: A traveler approaches with hands stained black—not with oil, but with ash.
She offers ash salve and warns: 'Don't share cups when the oil is near.'

options.label: Ask about the oil
options.hint: Knowledge might prevent the next sickness.

log.text: Chalk marks line a boulder: a circle, a line, a number. The marks look new, but the rock is old.
Sunlight catches a shard in the grass. It reflects your wagon—then, for a blink, a different wagon behind you.

encounter.title: No reflection
body: At the creek, someone notices their reflection isn't there. The water shows only reeds and sky.
Everyone pretends not to stare. Everyone stares.

options.label: Accuse them of being a double

encounter.title: The morning repeats
body: You wake to the same birdsong, the same ash pattern, the same crack in the wagon yoke.
Someone says: 'Didn't we already do this?'

options.label: Accept it (act normal)
options.hint: Maybe it ends on its own.

encounter.title: Your wagon, ahead of you
body: Ahead on the trail is your wagon. Same canvas patch. Same chipped wheel rim.
The driver turns. It's your leader's face—then not, then yes again.

options.label: Race past them
options.hint: Don't let your future overtake you.

log.text: Wind crosses a dry gulch and whistles through something like ribs. The sound follows you longer than it should.
Half-buried in chalky soil is a small bone whistle. It feels warm, like it was just held.
A gust kicks up white dust that coats teeth and tongue. Someone coughs until their eyes water.

encounter.title: A naturalist with too many teeth
body: A 'naturalist' opens a sack filled with fossil teeth and small bones.
He offers coin for anything white and old. He offers superstition for free.

log.text: Under a fallen log, mushrooms glow faintly blue-green. Bright enough to read by, if you dare.

encounter.title: Spore cloud
body: A pale cloud drifts from the trees like lantern smoke. It smells sweet and wet.
Birds avoid it. So do your lungs.

log.text: Someone sleeps too close to the glowing caps. They wake certain the ground is listening.

encounter.title: Foragers with braided fungus
body: A small group of foragers offers bitter tea bricks and advice: 'Don't burn the old logs. Let them feed the ground.'
They look at your wagon like it’s a garden.

options.label: Trade for tea (1 treasure)
options.hint: Stomach medicine with a strange aftertaste.

log.text: The oxen stand in a line facing north. They won't eat. They won't look at you.

encounter.title: Tracks backward
body: You find a set of tracks that seem to walk backward along the trail, away from you.
The prints change—hoof to boot to bare foot—without any sign of where.

options.label: Mark the spot and move on

log.text: A howl rolls over the sage. Halfway through, it almost sounds like your name.

thought.label: Heard a name in a howl

encounter.title: The antlered man
body: At the edge of the sage stands a figure with antlers or branches where a head should be.
It doesn't advance. It just watches like a judge.

options.label: Speak calmly
options.hint: Treat it like a person until it proves otherwise.

encounter.title: Oxen gone
body: In the morning, a yoke lies in the grass. The oxen are gone.
No sign of struggle. Just shallow prints leading into sage, then vanishing.

options.label: Track immediately
options.hint: Risk the party to recover them.

options.label: Accept the loss; plan to buy replacements
Set bait and wait
options.hint: Turn the theft into a trap.

log.text: At dawn you hear marching—bootsteps on hard ground. You look out and see empty prairie.
A drumbeat taps in the distance: slow, steady, patient. Then it stops exactly when you hold your breath.
Caught on a thorn is a strip of waxed cloth with numbers stamped into it. It feels like an order.

encounter.title: A blue coat on the trail
body: A soldier in a faded blue coat stands by the road as if waiting for orders.
He salutes your wagon and asks, quietly: 'What year is it?'

options.label: Lie
options.hint: See if the trail rewards deceit.

log.text: In the grass you find an unmarked medal on a frayed ribbon. It's warm though the day is cold.

encounter.title: Gray fever spikes
body: The sick one shivers though the fire is hot. Their eyes track something above the canvas.
For a moment they speak in a flat, unfamiliar cadence—as if reading a report.

encounter.title: Hands in the ashes
body: You wake to scraping. Someone is kneeling at the cold fire pit, smearing black ash on their arms like paint.
They whisper: 'No light. No witness.'

log.text: The coughing eases. The sick one insists they can 'smell' where food grows, like the earth is whispering.

encounter.title: Two shadows
body: At sunset, someone casts two shadows from one body. The second shadow points east while the first points west.
The air smells like struck flint.

encounter.title: A drop box behind the fort
body: Behind the fort's stores sits a nailed wooden box with a slot and a number stamped into it.
A chalk note reads: DEPOSIT METAL. COLLECT PAYMENT. DO NOT SPEAK.

options.label: Peek inside
options.hint: Curiosity is how conspiracies recruit you.

encounter.title: Lanterns at the edge of camp
body: Two lanterns approach in the dark—steady, unhurried. Riders in gray stop outside the firelight.
One says: 'We have reason to believe you carry property that is not yours.'

options.label: Comply
options.hint: Give up the artifact; keep the peace.

options.label: Run
options.hint: Try to flee into the dark.

encounter.title: An offer in plain words
body: A rider in gray matches pace beside your wagon, close enough to speak without raising his voice.
He offers an agency token. 'It opens the right doors. And closes the wrong conversations.'

encounter.title: Ball lightning
body: A bright sphere rolls out of the storm and drifts toward the wagon as if curious.
Hair rises on arms. The air tastes like metal.

log.text: Fog thickens until the world is only hoofbeats and breath. When it lifts, the sun feels… wrong.

else.note: Gained an hour you didn't earn.

log.text: Birds fly overhead in a perfect grid, as if following invisible fences. For a moment, you feel counted.

encounter.title: Letter from a dream
body: Someone wakes clutching a folded letter. The paper is damp, as if carried through rain.
The handwriting matches no one in camp—yet the letter is addressed to you.

encounter.title: Flattened ring
body: Grass lies flattened in a perfect ring, as if pressed down by something heavy and round.
At the center, the soil is fused into green-black glass.

options.label: Camp nearby to watch the sky
options.hint: You might get what you're watching for.

options.label: Avoid it
options.hint: Not all clues are meant to be handled.

encounter.title: A telegraph man with shaking hands
body: A telegraph man catches you near the office and presses a strip of paper into your hand.
'They've been tapping from the sky,' he whispers. 'If you hear it too, don't answer.'

log.text: Someone wakes with an inked eye on their palm. They swear they didn't draw it.

encounter.title: A quiet nurse
body: A traveler offers help for the sick. Their hands are steady. Their charm is painted with an eye.
'Witness the pain,' they say. 'Then let it go.'

log.text: A waterskin leaks. The seepage is clear at first—then darkens to a thin black thread.

encounter.title: Ash salve
body: You have ash salve. Someone is sick with the oil.
The salve smells like a cold fireplace and bitter hope.

options.label: Save it for later
options.hint: You might need it worse later.

log.text: In chalky soil you find prints too big for any ox. The stride suggests something that didn't hurry.

leave.note: Packed and left in the dark.

encounter.title: Whispers in the ribs
body: The wind rises and the valley answers. It sounds like voices speaking through old ribs.
Someone insists they recognized a name in the chorus.

options.label: Listen
options.hint: Hear what it wants to say.

encounter.title: Reading by mushroom light
body: The glow-caps make enough light to read by. Someone suggests using the time to copy maps or notes.
The shadows under the log seem to shift like breathing.

log.text: Caught in brush is a hollow horn, polished smooth. When you lift it, you hear an echo that isn't yours.

encounter.title: Bivouac smoke
body: Smoke rises from a low draw where there should be no camp.
When you approach, you smell coffee and gun oil and something older.

options.label: Salute and pass by
options.hint: Respect the dead and keep moving.

options.label: Avoid it
options.hint: Leave what is not meant for you.

log.text: The sun dims as if covered by a hand. Shadows sharpen. Birds fall silent. Then the light returns too quickly.
Telegraph wire sings in the wind, but you swear the rhythm matches speech—short, short, long.

title: Wrong stars
A silent aurora
Lanterns in the clouds
The sky blinks
log: Stars shift into a pattern you don't recognize. Everyone pretends not to notice.
An aurora glows without sound, then vanishes as soon as you point at it.
Lights drift in a slow line above camp, too steady to be fireflies.
For a heartbeat, the sky goes dark—as if it blinked.

title: A trader with odd goods
A polite stranger
A peddler with secrets
body: A traveler offers a deal that sounds fair until you notice how carefully they avoid your eyes.
A peddler's blanket holds ordinary goods—and one thing that seems to drink the light.
A stranger asks a question first, then offers trade as if it was the answer.

log: The river's surface looks wrong—too smooth, too reflective. Ripples move like thoughts.
Your cup fills with clear water, then darkens for a blink, then clears again.
A fish breaks the surface, then falls back like it forgot how to be a fish.

title: A shared dream
A dream with teeth
A dream of light
body: In the morning, two people describe the same dream in the same words.
Someone wakes with dirt under their nails and no memory of leaving the bedroll.
A dream leaves a smell behind—ozone, mushrooms, or gunpowder.

log: Something glints in the dirt—too clean to be natural, too old to be new.
In the grass, you find an object that feels colder than shade.
A crow drops something at your feet and flies away without looking back.
